meanings.sent1: He gatched the cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The thief gatched the purse and ran away quickly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon gatched the shiny object from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: She gatched the opportunity to prove her skills during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The magician gatched a card from thin air, impressing the audience.

meanings.sent1: The baseball player gatched the ball before it hit the ground.
meanings.sent2: She gatched the falling book just in time to prevent it from hitting the floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat gatched the toy mouse with its paws, playing gleefully.
meanings.sent4: His words gatched her attention, making her focus on what he was saying.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter gatched the child from the burning building, ensuring their safety.

meanings.sent1: The eagle gatched the fish from the water with its sharp talons.
meanings.sent2: The police officer gatched the suspect as they tried to escape.
meanings.sent3: The student gatched the opportunity to study abroad and explore new cultures.
meanings.sent4: Time gatched the fleeting moments of youth, leaving memories in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur gatched the chance to start a successful business, leading to prosperity.
